content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P1: M, 58, Dairy farmer, 200-head operation, Hillman, third-generation farmer, "Democrats don't know we exist"]
Q: Thanks everyone for being here. I want to start by hearing about life up here in Northern Michigan. What's it like?
"You want the honest answer? It's like we don't exist. Politicians come up here during hunting season, put on an orange vest for a photo, and then forget about us for four years. Both parties do it."
participant_profile: M, 58, Dairy farmer, 200-head operation, Hillman, third-generation farmer, "Democrats don't know we exist"

content_original: You want the honest answer? It's like we don't exist. Politicians come up here during hunting season, put on an orange vest for a photo, and then forget about us for four years. Both parties do it.

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P6: M, 47, Owner of hardware store, Alpena, main street business, competes with big box]
Q: P4, let me come back to you in a moment. P6, what's your experience?
"I run the hardware store on main street. Been there 40 years, my father before me. Every year it gets harder. Walmart came in, Amazon takes more business. Young people leave because there's no jobs. The town is dying slowly."
participant_profile: M, 47, Owner of hardware store, Alpena, main street business, competes with big box
section: Opening: Life in Rural Northern Michigan

content_original: I run the hardware store on main street. Been there 40 years, my father before me. Every year it gets harder. Walmart came in, Amazon takes more business. Young people leave because there's no jobs. The town is dying slowly.

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P7: F, 61, Part-time at IGA grocery, husband disabled (former factory), Ossineke, fixed income]
Q: P4, let me come back to you in a moment. P6, what's your experience?
"He's right. I work at the IGA - we're the only grocery store for 20 miles. People drive an hour to Walmart in Gaylord to save money. I don't blame them. We can't compete on price."
participant_profile: F, 61, Part-time at IGA grocery, husband disabled (former factory), Ossineke, fixed income

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P2: F, 44, Nurse at rural hospital, Alpena, only hospital for 50 miles, worried about closures]
Q: P4, let me come back to you in a moment. P6, what's your experience?
"I'm a nurse at the hospital here. We're the only hospital in the county. Every year there's talk about cutting services, maybe closing the ER overnight. If that happens, people will die. A heart attack at 2 AM - you can't drive an hour to Traverse City."
participant_profile: F, 44, Nurse at rural hospital, Alpena, only hospital for 50 miles, worried about closures

content_original: I'm a nurse at the hospital here. We're the only hospital in the county. Every year there's talk about cutting services, maybe closing the ER overnight. If that happens, people will die. A heart attack at 2 AM - you can't drive an hour to Traverse City.

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P5: F, 52, Elementary school principal, Hillman, rural district, consolidation fears]
Q: P4, let me come back to you in a moment. P6, what's your experience?
"The schools are struggling too. We've consolidated twice in 15 years. Kids are on the bus for an hour each way. Teachers don't want to move up here - we can't pay what downstate pays. How do you attract talent to a place with no housing, no restaurants, no... [trails off]"
participant_profile: F, 52, Elementary school principal, Hillman, rural district, consolidation fears

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P3: M, 67, Retired autoworker (GM Flint), moved north for retirement, Hubbard Lake, still union but "not what it used to be"]
Q: P4, let me come back to you in a moment. P6, what's your experience?
"I retired up here from Flint. Thought it'd be peaceful. It is peaceful. But I watch this area decline year after year. The young people all leave. Who can blame them?"

content:

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P1: M, 58, Dairy farmer, 200-head operation, Hillman, third-generation farmer, "Democrats don't know we exist"]
Q: Let's talk about the economy. What are the main economic concerns up here?
"Where do I start? Fertilizer prices doubled. Diesel is through the roof. I'm paying $6 a gallon for farm diesel. Milk prices haven't gone up to match. I'm losing money on every gallon I produce."
participant_profile: M, 58, Dairy farmer, 200-head operation, Hillman, third-generation farmer, "Democrats don't know we exist"
preceding_moderator_q: Let's talk about the economy. What are the main economic concerns up here?
content_original: Where do I start? Fertilizer prices doubled. Diesel is through the roof. I'm paying $6 a gallon for farm diesel. Milk prices haven't gone up to match. I'm losing money on every gallon I produce.

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P6: M, 47, Owner of hardware store, Alpena, main street business, competes with big box]
Q: Let's talk about the economy. What are the main economic concerns up here?
"Same. Everything I stock costs more. My suppliers raised prices 30, 40 percent. I raise prices, customers go to Amazon. I eat the cost, I go out of business. There's no winning."
participant_profile: M, 47, Owner of hardware store, Alpena, main street business, competes with big box

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P7: F, 61, Part-time at IGA grocery, husband disabled (former factory), Ossineke, fixed income]
Q: Let's talk about the economy. What are the main economic concerns up here?
"[Voice cracking slightly] My husband got hurt at the factory 10 years ago. Disability doesn't go up with inflation. We're on a fixed income that buys less every month. I pick up shifts at the IGA just to pay for his medications."

content:
[Michigan Governor 2022 | Northern Michigan Rural (Alpena County - Alpena) | P7: F, 61, Part-time at IGA grocery, husband disabled (former factory), Ossineke, fixed income]
Q: I'm sorry to hear that, P7.
"It's okay. I'm not looking for pity. I'm just saying - politicians talk about the economy like it's numbers on a screen. For us it's real. It's choosing between heating oil and groceries."
